briefdescription.para: Creates picture bullet shape for the current list level.
Deletes picture bullet for the current list level.
Compares with the specified ListLevel.
Gets or sets the justification of the actual number of the list item.

detaileddescription.para: The list label is justified relative to the NumberPosition property.

briefdescription.para: Gets the custom number style format for this list level. For example: "a, รง, ฤ, ...".
Specifies character formatting used for the list label.
Returns image data of the picture bullet shape for the current list level.
True if the level turns all inherited numbers to Arabic, false if it preserves their number style.
Gets or sets the paragraph style that is linked to this list level.

detaileddescription.para: This property is null when the list level is not linked to a paragraph style. This property can be set to null.

briefdescription.para: Returns or sets the number format for the list level.

detaileddescription.para: Among normal text characters, the string can contain placeholder characters \x0000 to \x0008 representing the numbers from the corresponding list levels.

For example, the string "\x0000.\x0001)" will generate a list label that looks something like "1.5)". The number "1" is the current number from the 1st list level, the number "5" is the current number from the 2nd list level.
Null is not allowed, but an empty string meaning no number is valid.

briefdescription.para: Returns or sets the position (in points) of the number or bullet for the list level.

detaileddescription.para: NumberPosition corresponds to LeftIndent plus FirstLineIndent of the paragraph.

briefdescription.para: Returns or sets the number style for this list level.
Sets or returns the list level that must appear before the specified list level restarts numbering.

detaileddescription.para: The value of -1 means the numbering will continue.

briefdescription.para: Returns or sets the starting number for this list level.

detaileddescription.para: Default value is 1.

briefdescription.para: Returns or sets the tab position (in points) for the list level.

detaileddescription.para: Has effect only when TrailingCharacter is a tab.

briefdescription.para: Returns or sets the position (in points) for the second line of wrapping text for the list level.

detaileddescription.para: TextPosition corresponds to LeftIndent of the paragraph.

briefdescription.para: Returns or sets the character inserted after the number for the list level.
Calculates hash code for this object.

Reports the string representation of the ListLevel object for the specified index of the list item. Parameters specify the NumberStyle and an optional format string used when Custom is specified.
Defines formatting for a list level.

detaileddescription.para: You do not create objects of this class. List level objects are created automatically when a list is created. You access ListLevel objects via the ListLevelCollection collection.
Use the properties of ListLevel to specify list formatting for individual list levels.
